thread.title: Mount View drives, putts, chips to KVAC Class B crown
thread.title_full: Mount View drives, putts, chips to KVAC Class B crown

author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Ken Waltz and Mark Haskell)
title: Mount View drives, putts, chips to KVAC Class B crown
text:
Mount View drives, putts, chips to KVAC Class B crown Mustang Higgins co-medalist for Class B; Lewiston best in Class A By Ken Waltz and Mark Haskell | Oct 05, 2015 Courtesy of: Greg Reid Kennebec Valley Athletic Conference Class B high school golf champions from Mount View include, coach Craig Tozier, Stephen Koller, Westley Turner, Ross DeLorenzo, Cassidy Gerrish, Austin Higgins, Kasey Roberts, Joey Danna and Darrell Roberts. View More... 
Rockland — The Mount View High School golf team brought its "A" game to the course on Monday afternoon, Oct. 5 and that won the Mustangs the league's Class B title. 
The Mustangs, who finished 8-2 during the regular season and second in the Kennebec Valley Athletic Conference Class B Northern Division, won the league crown with a clutch, topnotch, consistent, team-wide performance on Monday at the Rockland Golf Course. 
Click for photos of Mount View golfers from the shootout. 
The league shootout, which included the three Class A division playoff winners and four playoff winners in Class B's two divisions, qualified the champs for a trip to the state team championship tournament on Saturday, Oct. 10 at the Natanis Golf Course in Vassalboro. 
While Mount View won for Class B, Lewiston proved the best in the league's Class A shootout. 
“I'm ecstatic, of course,” said Mount view coach Craig Tozier on his team's conference title. “Any coach would be. We knew going in anybody could win. Golf is one of those games where you have good days and bad days and you just try to keep your head in the game. We talked a lot about that, about staying focused and not having a blowout on any of the holes. 
“I told them to relax and play with confidence. And they did. They played as a team and I'm just very, very proud of them.” 
The Class B golfers played the par-34 back nine holes and the Class A golfers the par-36 front nine holes at RGC. 
The shootout originally was scheduled for Wednesday, Sept. 30, but heavy rain put a damper on that, and the event was moved to Oct. 5, which turned out to be a perfect day, weather-wise, for golf. 
In Class B, Mount View, which earned the right to attend the shootout with a second-round divisional playoff match victory over Waterville, was ranked second and undefeated Maine Central Institute of Pittsfield, first in the North Division, while Gardiner and Erskine Academy of South China were the South Division playoff match survivors. 
In Monday's shootout, Mount View, now 12-2 overall this season (only losses to MCI), finished first with a four-golfer, nine-hole stroke total of 170, to 172 for Gardiner, 173 for MCI and 195 for Erskine Academy. 
Thus, only three strokes over the 515 shots taken separated the top three Class B teams. 
Individually for Mount View, Austin Higgins finished with 37, Joey Danna 43, Ross DeLorenzo 44, Darrell Roberts 46 and Westley Turner and Cassidy Gerrish 47. 
Mount View's Higgins and MCI's Eric Dugas were co-medalists in Class B with 37s. 
Higgins qualified for the individual state championships as a freshman, did not play during his sophomore and junior years at Mount View and then returned as a senior. 
Tozier said Higgins “has been the medalist for about half the matches we've played,” which played a role in the Mustangs' top-notch campaign. 
“It's just been one of those years where everything's come together, everybody's worked hard and I'm just excited for them and for Mount View,” he said. 
In Class A, Messalonskee of Oakland, Lewiston and Brewer were division winners. Lewiston finished at 161, Messalonskee 172 and Brewer 185. 
The medalist for Class A was Lewiston's Stephanie Rodrigue with 38. 
The following is a summary of upcoming events: 
On Tuesday, Oct. 6, KVAC Class A and Class B state team and individual qualifier, 10 a.m. (Natanis, Vassalboro) 
On Saturday, Oct. 10, state Class A and Class B team championships, 10 a.m. (Natanis, Vassalboro) 
On Saturday, Oct. 17, state Class A and Class B individual championships, 10 a.m. (Natanis, Vassalboro)
